body: I've found that it is possible to run Extensible Service Proxy inside a docker container that accepts additional command line parameters. It allows to specify application server address to which nginx will proxy the requests and even specify path to custom nginx.conf file that will be used. That's great ! See discussion in google group for details at https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/google-cloud-endpoints/b0QtQoPwHzA
title: Is it possible to use "Google Cloud Enpoints" for backend APIs that are not hosted on "Google Platform"?
